channel.title: Help with basic fletching [508]
channel.description: Hey guys, im making my own custom fletching for my 508 [codeusa base] i have all my item on item codes correct but the case 946 [for the knife] it is not allowing me to have more than one case 946 [i know that makes sense] but how to i get around this problem? i can only use fletching atm for knife on log, not on any of my other logs because i cant duplicate cases? any help would be appreciated

yeah i just noticed that haha, thanks (: lets see if it works

edit* alright sweet it works. thanks for your help

item.title: Help with basic fletching [508]
item.dc:creator: @fashofasho fashofasho
item.description:
@fashofasho wrote:

[code]alright so would something like this look right?
case 946
if (usedWith == 1521) {
if(player.skillLvl[9] >= 10)
{
player.requestAnim(1248, 0);
player.appendExperience(1000, 9);
Engine.playerItems.deleteItem(player, 1521, pi.getItemSlot(player, 1521), 1);
Engine.playerItems.addItem(player, 841, 1);
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(player, “You make the Oak shortbow.”);
}
else
{
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(player, “You need 10 Fletching to make this.”);
}
}

                    if (usedWith == 1519) { 
                    if(player.skillLvl[9] >= 20)

{
player.requestAnim(1248, 0);
player.appendExperience(2500, 9);
Engine.playerItems.deleteItem(player, 1519, pi.getItemSlot(player, 1519), 1);
Engine.playerItems.addItem(player, 841, 1);
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(player, “You make the Willow shortbow.”);
}
else
{
player.getActionSender().sendMessage(player, “You need 20 Fletching to make this.”);
}
}
break;
break;[/code]

item.title: Help with basic fletching [508]
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

You could put a condition for each log inside the case.

case 945: if (itemId == logA) { //Do fletching stuff } if (itemId == logB) { //Do fletching stuff } if (itemId == logC) { //Do fletching stuff } if (itemId == logD) { //Do fletching stuff } break;

Or a switch statement within the switch statement

case 945: switch (logId) { case logA: //Do fletching stuff break; case logB: //Do fletching stuff break; case logC: //Do fletching stuff break; case logD: //Do fletching stuff break; } break;

Essentially what you’re already doing, but add more conditions so its not just one log. (Add them before that break; though)

Read full topic

item.title: Help with basic fletching [508]
item.dc:creator: @fashofasho fashofasho
item.description:
@fashofasho wrote:

so switch this – case 946 with the log – if (usedWith == 1521 946 here) { ???

case 946**1521 here**: if (usedWith == 1521) { if(player.skillLvl[9] >= 10) { player.requestAnim(1248, 0); player.appendExperience(1000, 9); Engine.playerItems.deleteItem(player, 1521, pi.getItemSlot(player, 1521), 1); Engine.playerItems.addItem(player, 841, 1); player.getActionSender().sendMessage(player, "You make the Oak shortbow."); } else { player.getActionSender().sendMessage(player, "You need 10 Fletching to make this."); } } break;
